No they shouldn't. No offence to BobCat but I think he does a great job just where he is and If BobCat goes all of his addons will disappear as squad doesn't want addon makers when and if they try to bring them into the company they will not, I repeat not bring your addons into the vanilla game at all.

Edited April 30, 2013 by hoodedarche0
Hmm..looks great! I would love a multifunction satellite (with mapsat, kethane, remotetech capability etc.). It would preferably be one to five parts, and would make a great payload for those shrouds

BobCat--

Thanks very much for adding commercial-style fairings! I use the Soyuz launcher for a lot of stuff -- this makes it even more useful.

I find myself using the Block D a lot as a final "kicker" stage as well -- compact and good dV for the size. Any plans to model a Fregat upper stage as well? Or would that be too similar to the Block D?

Dear Mr. Bobcat,

This mod of yours is really awesome! I wanted to build Mir, so I created a Docking Module (like in real life) and put it in the payload of the Buran. But when I magnetize to it, it started to spin around in all directions and eventually blow up. Is it a bug?
Agreed! If you want I can try to build one for you?

No they shouldn't. No offence to BobCat but I think he does a great job just where he is and If BobCat goes all of his addons will disappear as squad doesn't want addon makers when and if they try to bring them into the company they will not, I repeat not bring your addons into the vanilla game at all.

I agree. Squad its Squad...

Bobcat its Bobcat...

Not need change this situation

BobCat--

Thanks very much for adding commercial-style fairings! I use the Soyuz launcher for a lot of stuff -- this makes it even more useful.

I find myself using the Block D a lot as a final "kicker" stage as well -- compact and good dV for the size. Any plans to model a Fregat upper stage as well? Or would that be too similar to the Block D?

Fregat, yes, i think its possible.

Dear Mr. Bobcat,

This mod of yours is really awesome! I wanted to build Mir, so I created a Docking Module (like in real life) and put it in the payload of the Buran. But when I magnetize to it, it started to spin around in all directions and eventually blow up. Is it a bug?

Its wooble problem. You can fix it (partially) uses heavy strunt. Attach heavy strunt both end to arm and to buran crew section.
Three things I would really like being added to the pack are Fregat-MT (for Soyuz-2.1b), and Breeze-M and Block-DM for Proton-M LV.
Only Fregat SB

What about Luna 17 bus for Lunokhod?Would be great,and not just for Lunokhod.

If you have other ideas , write here.

I'll repeat myself but what the heck: Venera!

Among the other results, probes of the series became the first man-made devices to enter the atmosphere of another planet (Venera 4 on October 18, 1967), to make a soft landing on another planet (Venera 7 on December 15, 1970), to return images from the planetary surface (Venera 9 on June 8, 1975), and to perform high-resolution radar mapping studies of Venus (Venera 15 on June 2, 1983).
Wait...that is the Ye-8,right?Im already tired and I cant see properly, but if it is...and if I ever win in lotto...
yessssssss!!!!!!!

Wow!

...

I have NO IDEA what that is.

Fregat upper stage, used mostly on Soyuz-2.1a flights to put satellites into geosynchronous orbits.

Its an awesome little stage, glad to see you doing it BobCat!
oww,not Luna 17,Ye-8? Hope dies last I guess...

oww,not Luna 17,Ye-8? Hope dies last I guess...

Well, the Fregat stage was originally the propulsion module of the 1980s-generation Mars probes (i.e. Phobos), and is basically an upgraded/uprated version of the Ye-8 Luna descent stage. (The main change was making it restartable, I think.) So stick a set of legs on a Fregat stage, and you've got a pretty good equivalent of the Ye-8.
